title: Understanding Exothermic Reactions
text: Remember that in an exothermic reaction, heat is released as a product. Cooling the system removes heat.

title: Le Chatelier’s Principle
text: According to Le Chatelier’s principle, if a system at equilibrium is subjected to a change in temperature, the system will adjust to counteract that change.

title: Effect of Cooling
text: Cooling the system decreases the temperature. The equilibrium will shift to produce more heat to counteract the cooling effect.

title: Direction of Shift
text: Since the reaction is exothermic, producing more products will release heat. Which direction will the equilibrium shift to produce more heat?

title: Conclusion
text: Consider which side of the reaction releases heat. The equilibrium will shift towards the side that compensates for the cooling by releasing heat.
